image.altText: Anthony Albanese stands outside.

props.synopsis: The prime minister would not say exactly what Australia's critical minerals offer to the United States included — nor whether it was exclusive to the Trump administration, after he discussed the issue with his British counterpart.

title.children: 'We have great resources': PM coy on crucial Trump meeting amid tariff onslaught

image.altText: Kotoni Staggs roars after scoring a try for the Brisbane Broncos.

props.synopsis: Kotoni Staggs gets the Broncos on the board to start the second half after Paul Alamoti's first-half double ignited Penrith in the blockbuster preliminary final in Brisbane. Follow live.

title.children: Tempers flare after Cleary hammered as Broncos hit back against Penrith

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 48' TRY: Kotoni Staggs scores for Brisbane
Scott Sorensen reportedly pass his HIA: Fox League
HT: Penrith Panthers 14 leading Brisbane Broncos 0

image.altText: A man draped in a keffiyeh holds a megaphone

props.synopsis: Colombian President Gustavo Petro accuses the US of violating international law after it revoked his visa following his criticism of Israel's actions in Gaza.

title.children: Colombian leader tells Trump to 'distance yourself from Hitler'

image.altText: Donald Trump sits at a desk holding a black folder open with yellow-gold curtains and two flags behind him.

props.synopsis: The military says it is ready to mobilise as Donald Trump authorises "full force" to protect federal immigration facilities from "domestic terrorists".

title.children: Trump to deploy troops to 'war-ravaged' Portland, ICE facilities

image.altText: police cars on scene

props.synopsis: Police were called to a suburban shopping centre in the early hours of Sunday morning where they declared the man in his 40s dead.

title.children: Man suffers 'brutal and violent attack' before death at Brisbane shops

image.altText: A crowd of men, most wearing white shirts, gather around a small ambulance at night.

props.synopsis: Eight children and 16 women were among those who died at the political rally for Vijay — who is campaigning for election after becoming one of his state's most successful actors.

title.children: Stampede kills 36 people at political rally for popular Indian actor

image.altText: A group of colourful eggs sit in a basket on grass.

props.synopsis: Compulsory super has led to higher levels of national savings, but, as the pool of savings grows, many argue that stricter supervision is needed to protect Australians' retirement savings.

title.children: Up to 30,000 people at risk of losing some or all their super, ASIC boss warns

image.altText: Man in blue shirt and hat walking away from aircraft.

props.synopsis: Paul Smith, a 54-year-old pilot and sole occupant of the light plane, was returning to Moruya Airport after conducting a skydiving drop on Saturday afternoon when the accident happened.

title.children: Eight skydivers launched from plane just two minutes before fatal crash

image.altText: Selena Gomez and Benny Blanco smile at each other on their wedding day

props.synopsis: Singer, actor and beauty mogul Selena Gomez marries music producer Benny Blanco, with US media reporting Taylor Swift was in attendance at the star-studded affair.

title.children: Selena Gomez announces marriage to music producer with Taylor Swift among the guests

image.altText: A white bear with its paw raised like a high five, sitting on a deck with a blue sky background

props.synopsis: A group of polar bears that have taken over an abandoned polar research station off Russia's coast is intimately captured in drone footage.

title.children: Polar bears move into deserted research station in Russian Arctic

image.altText: A woman and a laughing buddha

props.synopsis: China's presence in the Pacific is often viewed in the context of geopolitical tension and rivalry. But Chinese people have been in the region for generations — these are their stories.

title.children: 'To eat bitterness': In the Pacific, there is 'old' Chinese and 'new' Chinese

props.synopsis: Exclusive data for 5.2 million couples shows nearly one in five marriages are between people of different religions – double the proportion recorded in 1986.

title.children: 'Love wins … sometimes': Data reveals the most and least likely pairs to marry

image.altText: Large NicheLiving sign hanging from fence sunset in background.

props.synopsis: Kathy Ellis was overjoyed to finally move into her new house after years of building delays. But within days, she discovered her shower was draining straight into the ceiling below.

title.children: Nicheliving customer left with leaking home after plumber uses wrong pipe

image.altText: black and white small dog in bed

props.synopsis: While there are several benefits to keeping our pets close at night, there are a few minor risks to consider.

title.children: Bedsharing with your dog has benefits — and some minor risks

image.altText: A tv and two radios on a shelf

props.synopsis: Analogue TVs, cameras and film projectors are just some of the items with sentimental value people fix rather than replace — and unlike much of today's technology, they were made to be repaired.

title.children: Retro gadgets stand test of time in an era of disposable tech

image.altText: A close-up selfie shot of Tom Saffioti smiling and holding up a football medal.

props.synopsis: New drivers face tougher regulations in WA including extending their probation period, increasing their supervised hours and limiting phone use under a proposed plan by the state government.

title.children: 'Tom's story' inspires tough new rules for young drivers

image.altText: Steam engine crossing a railway bridge.

props.synopsis: Forget about being crammed on a suburban train, the real romance of rail is found through luxury long-distance inland trips or journeys back in time.

title.children: Australia's greatest rail holidays for people who want to savour scenery

image.altText: Jesse Wardlaw shrugs and smiles as she celebrates a goal in an AFLW game.

props.synopsis: St Kilda outscores Port Adelaide 38-0 in the final quarter, including three straight goals to Jesse Wardlaw, after trailing by 27 points at three-quarter-time.

title.children: Wardlaw shines in Saints' record fourth-quarter comeback win

image.altText: house witth bins and a broken gate

props.synopsis: The woman was injured when she was hit by a vehicle during an alleged car theft while she was unloading groceries at her home on the Gold Coast.

title.children: Teens among three charged after woman injured in alleged carjacking

image.altText: A man stands between two ceremonial poles

props.synopsis: The family of vanished Yolŋu leader Dhakiyarr Wirrpanda is calling on the Northern Territory coroner to pursue an ABC investigation's lead on his mysterious disappearance.

title.children: Investigation unearths name of alleged confessed killer police officer

image.altText: Julia Robinson runs with the ball away from Yasmin Clydsdale.

props.synopsis: Brisbane is back in the NRLW grand final for the first time in five years, setting up the long-awaited clash with the Sydney Roosters after a 30-6 win over Newcastle.

title.children: Broncos return to NRLW grand final for first time since 2020

image.altText: Four Brisbane Lions AFL players celebrate with their premiership medals.

props.synopsis: With contributors across the board, the Brisbane Lions clinically dismantled Geelong to show last year's premiership victory was no fluke.

title.children: Lions show why they're the complete team with second straight flag

image.altText: Sergey Lavrov stands at lectern with UN symbol on the front

props.synopsis: While Russia does not intend to attack Europe, its Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov has not ruled out action against NATO aggression.

title.children: Russian minister warns NATO any aggression will be met with a 'decisive response'

image.altText: Katherine Bennell-Pegg poses wearing an raaf jumpsuit and baseball cap

props.synopsis: With Sydney to play host to the world's largest space conference this coming week, Katherine Bennell-Pegg says it is more important than ever to highlight the benefits of growing Australia's space workforce.

title.children: Australia's first female astronaut says we 'need more women space'

image.altText: Padington bear standing inside a wood paneled room

props.synopsis: From family favourites to Australia's most controversial soap opera, here's some of the best movies and TV you can watch right now — no fee required!

title.children: No more streaming fees, these films and TV series are free to watch

image.altText: Tom in a blue suit and tie with his arms crossed. He stares at the camera. The Hard Quiz Kids logo is in the top left corner

props.synopsis: The grump's back to take on the grommets in a new series of Hard Quiz Kids. Don't let the pint-sized know-it-alls show you up.

title.children: It's time to put Australia's pint-sized hot shots in their place. Let's play, HARD!

image.altText: a boy in cowboy hat and shirt in front of trees

props.synopsis: In a huge dark hat and shining belt buckle, a 10-year-old from Cape York proves he can mix it with the best at the world finals in Utah.

title.children: Small bull rider with a 'big heart' takes on the world's best

image.altText: An older woman holding a cup of tea at a table.

props.synopsis: Jindabyne is grappling with how to capitalise on its winter tourism influx while ensuring long-term residents can continue to afford to live there.

title.children: Snow town struggles as high housing prices force residents out

image.altText: A drag queen wearing a pink tassled outfit dancing on an outdoor stage.

props.synopsis: A regional queer community says acceptance is improving in regional areas, but vandalism targeting an LGBTQI+ event shows there is still a way to go.

title.children: 'Horrible' vandalism of signs shows need for pride event, organiser says

image.altText: Kirra Wright standing with the Australian flag at the World Para Athletics Championships in New Delhi.

props.synopsis: At just 17, Kirra Wright reaches the podium at the world titles after setting a personal best in winning the silver medal in New Delhi.

title.children: Wright claims silver for Australia at World Para Athletics Championships

image.altText: A bob cat in front of a very large pile of coal

props.synopsis: Despite a change of government, Queensland's controversial coal royalty scheme remains in place and recent job cuts are prompting renewed discussion about it.

title.children: Queensland's 'golden goose' coal royalty regime questioned again

image.altText: Liam and Noel Gallagher pose in shirt and white jacket respectively against beige backdrop

props.synopsis: They'll soon tour Australia, but 30 years ago, Oasis were about to release (What's The Story) Morning Glory? — an enduring British rock classic. Here's how they did it.

title.children: Oasis's 'biblical' reunion is largely thanks to this blockbuster album

image.altText: Del sticks her tongue out, pretending to be a cat and wearing her costume and sitting near the stage.

props.synopsis: By day, Canberra public servant Del Goncalves works in a typical office and wears typical office clothes, but come nightfall, she dons a bunny costume and trades her office for a wrestling ring.

title.children: Canberra car dealers and public servants by day, pro wrestlers by night

image.altText: A dark-coloured feral pig on some grass near a patch of mud.

props.synopsis: Dozens of pigs were released illegally over several attempts to establish populations for hunting, with a local landscape board warning of the danger a feral population could cause.

title.children: Feral pigs found in SA were imported illegally from NSW, testing shows

image.altText: A man pushes another man sitting on a mock toilet.

props.synopsis: Forget balloon darts and whack-a-mole, at this bush carnival, you'll find swag throwing, dunny racing and cow-pat discus.

title.children: The bush festival that celebrates riding a loo and shooting roo poo
